item.title: Dropbox and Microsoft collaborating more effectively
item.description:
Source: Microsoft. Dropbox and Microsoft are joining forces to make it easier for their users to work together. This collaboration will allow users to seamlessly work with Dropbox and Microsoft Office on their phones, tablets, and computers. Given that over 1.2 billion people use Microsoft Office and 35 billion Office files are stored in Dropbox, this partnership has the potential to benefit a lot of users. This integration will enable users to edit their Dropbox documents directly in the relevant Office application...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/dropbox-and-microsoft-collaborating-more-effectively/

item.title: Transfer files from your phone without using up your mobile data
item.description:
Xender, a Chinese app, simplifies phone-based file sharing without incurring mobile data costs using peer-to-peer technology. For device-to-device transfers, Xender creates a local Wi-Fi hotspot that nearby users can join. This allows for the seamless sharing of photos, music, files, and apps between phones, proving particularly useful when upgrading to a new device. Xender boasts unlimited file sizes, cross-platform compatibility, and transfer speeds up to 50 times faster than Bluetooth...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/transfer-files-from-your-phone-without-using-up-your-mobile-data/
